intro: Comesperma tenue, commonly known as the slender comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its limited distribution, Comesperma tenue is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
